--- title: Demo Project keywords: fastai sidebar: home_sidebar summary: "This is solely to explain the steps involved in building a library out of your notebooks and `nbdev`." description: "This is solely to explain the steps involved in building a library out of your notebooks and `nbdev`." nb_path: "nbs/index.ipynb" ---
{% raw %}
{% endraw %}
  1. Make a template out of this-repo
  2. Clone it
    $ git clone https://github.optum.com/yreddy31/demo-nbdev
  3. Modify settings.ini
  4. Add your notebooks in nbs folder
  5. Build the library
    $ nbdev_build_lib
$ cd nbs && ln -s ../demo . && cd ..
  6. Test the library
    $ nbdev_test_nbs
  7. Build the docs
    $ nbdev_build_docs
  8. Verify the docs are built properly
    $ make docs_serve
    {% include important.html content='Ensure jekyll is properly built on your machine. This is needed for serving docs.' %}

How to use

index.ipynb should be the notebook that introduces users to your library. You just need to add the important code snippets and the docs will be automatically built.

{% raw %} 
c = Circle(10)
print(f'Area:\t\t{c.area}\nPerimeter:\t{c.perimeter}')

Area:		314.1592653589793
Perimeter:	62.83185307179586
{% endraw %}
